header.name: Language
header.p: The process by which children come to understand and communicate language during early childhood.

header.name: Articulation
header.p: The movement of the tongue, lips, jaw, and other speech organs in order to make speech sounds.

header.name: Social
header.p: The skills we use to communicate and interact with each other, both verbally and non-verbally, through gestures, body language and our personal appearance.

team.name: Sara Barron
info: I have a bachelor’s degree in pre-school education issued by the University of Fresno in
California. I have worked for TriCounties Speech Services for 8 years, and I have dedicated
myself to helping families with guidance, education and training to achieve the individual goals
of each child I have worked with. My priority is to participate in the generalized growth of each
child I must serve with their families. For me, it is a privilege to work and be able to help their
families in everything that is within my reach. I am a blessed woman with a family of two
daughters and a husband who supports me in my goals.
Tengo una Licenciatura en Educación Preescolar emitida por la Universidad de Fresno en
California. He trabajado para TriCounties Speech Services durante 8 años, y me he dedicado a
ayudar a las familias con orientación, educación y capacitación para alcanzar las metas
individuales de cada niño con el que he trabajado. Mi prioridad es participar en el crecimiento
generalizado de cada niño al que debo servir junto con sus familias. Para mí es un privilegio
trabajar y poder ayudar a sus familias en todo lo que esté a mi alcance. Soy una mujer bendecida
con una familia de dos hijas y un esposo que me apoya en mis metas.

team.name: Veronica Hernandez
info: I am a graduate of California State University Monterey Bay where I received my Bachelor of
Arts in Psychology. I have a background in Behavior Therapy with a private practice where I
obtained my certificates in Therapeutic Crisis Intervention and Crisis Prevention Intervention. As
an Early Interventionist, my favorite part is being able to work with infants and toddlers in any
developmental delays and help them reach their goals. I also enjoy working with the parents
and providing them with teaching techniques to help support their children.

team.name: Jovita Barron Reyes
info: I obtained both my BA and MA from San Jose State University. I have worked in a wide range of speech therapy
including the school setting, Home Health, hospital setting as well as a private practice. My experience is
working with toddlers, young children, and you young adults with communication delays and disorders in the
areas of oral-motor, articulation, phonology, developmental apraxia of speech, receptive and expressive
language, learning disabilities, pragmatics/social skills, Asperger’s, Autism, and Bilingual Assessments.

ul: ASHA certified with the highest certification of CCC
California State License administered by California Speech Pathology and Audiology Board

team.name: Lorena Scalmanini
info: I am a graduate of San Jose State University where I received my Bachelor of Arts and my Masters of Arts in
Communication Disorders. My experience includes serving private practice clients as well as special needs
children in the public school. I have also served as a university clinic supervisor. My experience is working
with toddlers, young children, and you young adults with communication delays and disorders in the areas of
oral-motor, articulation, phonology, developmental apraxia of speech, receptive and expressive language,
learning disabilities, pragmatics/social skills, Asperger’s, Autism, and Bilingual Assessments. My favorite
part of my position as a Speech-Language Pathologist is helping their families learn ways to support their
child and giving them the tools they need to foster their child’s growth in speech and language.

ul: ASHA certified with the highest certification of CCC
California State License administered by California Speech Pathology and Audiology Board

team.name: Raisa Arce
info: I was born and raised in Salinas, CA. I obtained my A.A. Degree from Hartnell College and my
B.A. in Psychology from California State University of Monterey Bay. I enjoy working with our
local families and helping them reach their child's developmental milestones. As an Early
Interventionist with TriCounties Speech Services, Inc., I seize the opportunity to express
creativity, relating to a variety of different personalities and impacting the starting point of a
child's educational learning.

team.name: Nicole Judah
info: I am currently a Early Intervention specialist with TriCounties Speech Services serving families
within Santa Clara County. I graduated from San Jose State University with a Bachelors of Arts
in Psychology in 2013, and from Arizona State University with a Masters in Education in Applied
Behavior Analysis in 2017. Before working with TriCounties Speech Services I provided
behavior support services to children in school and home based settings. I am very passionate
about enhancing caregivers capacity to support their child and having a positive impact on the
families I serve. In my free time I enjoys hiking, reading, and playing with my three cats.

team.name: Mary Barron
info: I enjoy working with families and helping them achieve their children's goals. As an early
interventionist at TriCounties Speech Services, Inc., I have the opportunity to express my
creativity and knowledge to help my students reach their full potential. I love my job and the
satisfaction it gives me both professionally and personally.

team.name: Evelyn Rodriguez
info: I am a graduate of Brandman University where I received my Bachelor of Arts in Liberal Studies.
I have a background working as a toddler and preschool teacher with children ages 0 to 5. As an
Early Interventionist, my favorite part is being able to work with infants and toddlers in any
developmental delays and help them reach their goals. I also enjoy working with the parents and
providing them with teaching techniques to help support their children.

team.name: Crystal Cornejo
info: My Name is Crystal Cornejo and I grew up in the Central Valley and
moved to San Jose to attend college. I attended Evergreen College
where I studied Business Administration.  As the Office Administrator
for TriCounties Speech Services, Inc. my job is to oversee the office
operations and I am committed to making our clients and their families
experience in our office a positive one!
